title: XEN_Protocol
author: XEN_Protocol
content: I just found out that not all multi chain wallets work the same way, if I have to rate a wallet base on adding Chain/Network Metamask will be the winner.Only Metamask has Network NameNew RPC URLChain IDCurrency SymbolBlock Explorer URLWhy is this not available on Trust wallet and others? If your token isn't on BSC, ETH, Tron and few other popular projects you are out of luck using Trust wallet, no room for new Chain/Network unless the team add them, this sucks..

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: This is related to Altcoins. I suggest that you edit the topic title (make it more descriptive) and move the topic to a more appropriate board.

comments.author: Tony116
comments.body: You are wrong, trustwallet has same feature as metamask, you can also add new network or new token right on trustwallet wallet. Now, I no longer use trustwallet on my phone so I cant guide you, but I remember exactly I used to use trustwallet to add new tokens. But if you often use your computer to work, then metamask is a better choice as it has both browser and mobile versions. As FatFork said, you should edit the title accordingly.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: They're doing that to reduce against scam coins listed on their wallet, I wouldn't call it sucks, but if your project are genuine and will become big, your coins and network will be listed by them. So you need to prove if your project isn't scam first.Quote from: Tony116 on October 31, 2022, 09:39:54 AMYou are wrong, trustwallet has same feature as metamask, you can also add new network or new token right on trustwallet wallet.If you're don't know what you're talking about, it's better to shut your mouth than spreading false information. It's impossible to add other network, Trust Wallet only serve some network they've list and you're can only add new token with that's network, you're not allowed to add new network. If you don't believe, install Trust Wallet and try it yourself.
